1957 11 Disciplinary problems until 9th grade (age 14); laughed at inappropriate times

Referred to Ellen Roberts (a special education teacher); Got in a fight with Tommy
1961 15 Left school; Moved in with brother Lonnie
Moved back home; Parents got him a new car; Starting working with dad as a concrete
1963 17 Got a motorcycle; Started testing the law

Charged on 8 counts of theft and burglary, 4 counts from Milam county (14 counts
01/22/1965 19 total – sentenced to 52 years, but they all ran consecutive so he only was sent for 4

column3: Got out of jail on parole
Met Roy at Bremond State Dance
Went out with Lonnie and Roy
Headed to Fort Worth
Killed three teens at a ball field in Everman, TX: Robert Brand (WM, 18), MarkDunman (WM, 16), and Edna Louise Sullivan (WF, 16). Took the girl’s necklace as asouvenir.
Date with Jo-Ann.  Bodies of Brand and Dunman are found.
Partner (Roy) confessed; McDuff arrested in Fort Worth, TX.
Put in jail without parole
Tried for murder
Convicted and sentenced to death
Court confirmed conviction; Set execution date for 12/3/1968
Went to Texas Department of Corrections
Offered $10,000 for early parole; Supreme Court deemed death penalty unjust inTexas
Got his GED in jail, and took 45 hours of college credit; Bribed guard to smuggledrugs in for him
Eligible for parole but was denied
Got a new lawyer because his 1966 case was filed wrong, wasn’t given correct rights
Charges were dropped on rape part of 1966 trial because it was an unfair trial
Was convicted of Bribery (delayed parole)
Was paroled in Texas
Sarafia Parker (F, 31) is strangled to death in Temple, Texas
Sent back to prison for violation of parole, released after 2 months
Enrolled at Texas State Technical Institute
Brenda Thompson (WF, 37) is strangled to death in Waco, Texas
Regina DeAnne Moore (17) is strangled  to death in Waco, Texas
Colleen Reed (W, 28) abducted from a car wash
Valencia Kay Joshua (BF, 22) is strangled to death in Waco, Texas.
Federal case against him for LSD and having a concealed weapon
Melissa Northrop (WF, 22) disappeared from a convenience store in Waco, Texas;McDuff’s car found a block away from the store
Parole officer charged McDuff in Waco for parole violation
Valencia found near Texas State Technical Institute
Arrested under the name Richard Fowler in a prostitute sting in Kansas City, MO
Northrop’s body was found (Dallas)
Alva Hank Worley confessed he and McDuff killed, kidnapped, and sexually assaultedColleen Reed
Police received a call from a guy saying he had seen McDuff on America’s MostWanted and that McDuff was his garbage man
Arrested (America’s Most Wanted 208th capture)
Convicted of the Northrop murder (found 5 of Reed’s hair in McDuff’s car)
Jury selection began
Roy Green came out as accomplice and told the story of what happened
Found guilty of killing Reed (jury took 55 minutes)
State appeals; court upholds death sentence
Court set 10/21 as his death date
Judge Smith granted stay of execution
Skeleton found to be Regina Moore (Waco)
Another body found to be Brenda Thompson (Waco)
Found Colleen Reed (near Marlin)
Announced that he had Hepatitis C and cirrhosis of the liver
Death by lethal injection
